snippet: The Rangers’ Ryan McDonagh led all skaters in ice time with 53:17 of the 114:41, blocked eight shots and helped shut down the Capitals star Alex Ovechkin in the triple overtime game.
abstract: New York Rangers defenseman Ryan McDonagh skated more than 53 minutes in team's triple-overtime playoff victory over Washington Capitals, the most of any player.

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and TIM WENDEL

lead_paragraph: The Rangers’ Ryan McDonagh led all skaters in ice time with 53:17 of the 114:41, blocked eight shots and helped shut down the Capitals star Alex Ovechkin in the triple overtime game.

headline.seo: Ryan McDonagh and Rangers Teammates Earn a Day Off
headline.main: Some Rest for the Weary: An Iron Man in Game 3 Earns a Day Off
headline.print_headline: Some Rest for the Weary: An Iron Man in Game 3 Earns a Day Off
